title: Applying Trained Registration to Label Results in Interpolation on the Boundaries
body:
**Task** (what are you trying to do/register?)

First of all, thank you very much for putting this code together and making it available.  I really appreciate it!!  
So, I have successfully trained a network in Voxelmorph and would like to validate my registration using label comparison statistics (such as Dice, etc.).  I am able to pass two CT volumes into the network and get a good looking registered CT.  However, if I apply this corresponding warp field to a label map of the source CT's segmentations the boundaries of each label become mixed in values. With these mixed values I cannot use the label comparison methods.  

**What have you tried**

I used the nrn_layers.SpatialTransformer with nearest interpolation.  However there still appears to be some interpolation occurring on the boundaries.

code used:

**y_seg = nrn_layers.SpatialTransformer(interp_method='nearest', indexing=indexing)([src_seg, flow])**

-y_seg is the resulting deformed segmentation label map
-indexing is set to 'ij'
-src_seg is the original source undeformed segmentation label map
-flow is the flow field output from the Voxelmorph network.


example of output:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28455475/75955616-1aa8c080-5e6b-11ea-8d8e-d4012fa9d4e1.png)

**Details of experiments**

I have dug through the source code a bit trying to see where the interpolation was occurring and if it was somehow possible for me to fix, however after several hours of searching I decided to post here and ask for help.  I'm not sure if you have seen this happen?  

Thank you in advance,
-E
